measured_by: risky-choice rate (R-rate) / propensity to choose the risky option
justification: “Dependent variables, i.e., the propensity to choose the risky option (R-rate)… were analyzed…” – explicitly linking risk preference to the R-rate measure.
The same sentence states “…or the optimal –EV maximizing– option (O-rate)”, identifying O-rate as the operational measure of choice optimality.

measured_by: probability of repeating a risky choice after previous outcome (repeatRisky)
justification: “To investigate possible learning effects… we analyzed the probability of repeating a risky choice as a function of the outcome received in the previous trial… any… learning process would induce a ‘positive recency’ effect” – specifying this repeatRisky metric as the learning indicator.

measured_by: decrease in probability of repeating a risky choice after a rewarded risky choice
justification: “The probability of repeating a risky choice was lower after receiving positive feedback… The observed behavioral pattern exhibits in fact negative recency, which is better understood as a manifestation of the gambler's fallacy” – tying the negative-recency measure to the gambler’s fallacy construct.
